oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Aspects of organochalcogen (S, Se, Te) compounds stabilized by intramolecular coordination
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MUGESH, G
PANDA, A
SINGH, HB
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: monomeric selenolato complexes
thiol peroxidase-activity
chiral selenium-compounds
ray crystal-structure
glutathione-peroxidase
asymmetric methoxyselenenylation
<2,3>sigmatropic rearrangement
organoselenium reagent
antioxidant activity
amino group
intramolecular coordination
metal chalcogenolates
glutathione peroxidase mimics
hybrid chalcogen ligands
selenium macrocycles
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The application of intramolecular coordination in the isolation of novel diaryl diselenides and their derivatives, monomeric chalcogenolato complexes of group 12 metals, glutathione peroxidase mimics, hybrid bi-, tri- and multidentate ligands and selenium-containing azamacrocycles is described.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: PROCEEDINGS OF THE INDIAN ACADEMY OF SCIENCES-CHEMICAL SCIENCES,112(3)239-248
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Symposium on Modern Trends in Inorganic Chemistry,BANGALORE, INDIA,JAN 18-20, 2000
